sect2.title: Introduction to Expect
sect2.para: The Expect package contains tools for automating interactive applications such as telnet, ftp, passwd, fsck, rlogin, tip, etc. Expect is also useful for testing these same applications as well as easing all sorts of tasks that are prohibitively difficult with anything else.

sect2.title: Installation of Expect
sect2.para: Install Expect by running the following commands:

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --enable-shared: This option enables building the shared library.
--with-tk=/usr/lib: Use this option to link in the Tk library.
ln -sf ../libexpect5.42.a /usr/lib/expect5.42: This command creates a required link to the static library.

sect3.title: Config files
sect3.para: $exp_library/expect.rc and ~/.expect.rc

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: Reference the expect man page for information about utilizing the expect.rc configuration files. Additionally, many of the tools contained in the Expect package will use their own configuration files. Reference the respective man page, or examine the script directly for configuration file information.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Expect package contains the libexpect libraries, autoexpect, autopasswd, cryptdir, decryptdir, dislocate, expect, ftp-rfc, kibitz, lpunlock, mkpasswd, passmass, rftp, rlogin-cwd, timed-read, timed-run, unbuffer, weather and optionally (if expect was linked against Tk), expectk, multixterm, tknewsbiff, tkpasswd, xkibitz and xpstat.

sect3.title: autoexpect
sect3.para: autoexpect generates an Expect script from watching a session.

sect3.title: autopasswd
sect3.para: autopasswd is a wrapper to make passwd(1) be non-interactive.

sect3.title: cryptdir
sect3.para: cryptdir encrypts all files in a directory.

sect3.title: decryptdir
sect3.para: decryptdir decrypts all files in a directory.

sect3.title: dislocate
sect3.para: dislocate allows processes to be disconnected and reconnected to a terminal.

sect3.title: expect
sect3.para: expect is a program that talks to other interactive programs according to a script.

sect3.title: ftp-rfc
sect3.para: ftp-rfc retrieves an rfc (or the index) from uunet.

sect3.title: kibitz
sect3.para: kibitz allows two (or more) people to interact with one shell (or any arbitrary program).

sect3.title: lpunlock
sect3.para: lpunlock unhangs a printer which claims it is waiting for lock.

sect3.title: mkpasswd
sect3.para: mkpasswd generates passwords and can apply them automatically to users.

sect3.title: passmass
sect3.para: passmass changes a password on multiple machines.

sect3.title: rftp
sect3.para: rftp is much like ftp except it uses '~g' and '~p' instead of 'mget' and 'mput'.

sect3.title: rlogin-cwd
sect3.para: rlogin-cwd is rlogin except it uses the local current directory as the current working directory on the remote machine.

sect3.title: timed-read
sect3.para: timed-read reads a complete line from stdin and aborts after a given number of seconds.

sect3.title: timed-run
sect3.para: timed-run runs a program for a given amount of time.

sect3.title: unbuffer
sect3.para: unbuffer disables the output buffering that occurs when program output is redirected.

sect3.title: weather
sect3.para: weather retrieves a weather report (courtesy University of Michigan) for a given city or geographical area.

sect3.title: expectk
sect3.para: expectk is a combination of Expect with Tk and should run any wish or Expect script.

sect3.title: multixterm
sect3.para: multixterm creates multiple xterms that can be driven together or separately.

sect3.title: tknewsbiff
sect3.para: tknewsbiff pops up a window when there is unread news in your favorite newsgroups and removes the window after you've read the news.

sect3.title: tkpasswd
sect3.para: tkpasswd is a script to change passwords using expectk.

sect3.title: xkibitz
sect3.para: xkibitz allows users in separate xterms to share one shell (or any program that runs in an xterm).

sect3.title: xpstat
sect3.para: xpstat is a script that acts as a front-end for xpilot.
